reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The other reviews are correct that this is a very good location, the staff at the hotel are excellent, the shuttle serice can't be beat, and the hotel itself is lovely in its decor and ambiance. The one thing that was not really that good was that the bathroom was soooo small I had to sit sideways on the toilet in order to use it. I am a 5'10" woman about 125lbs and there was a heater right infront of the toilet and it was impossible to sit on it properly. Now I have visited Europe about 8 times and I KNOW that European hotel rooms are not like North American ones so I am not one to constantly complain about the room size BUT the design of this bathroom was crazy - there was not one towel hook and most of our stuff had to be kept out on the desk. The bed was very good and the rest of the room was OK but they must have other complaints about the toilet in this room - if I was any taller or a larger person I probably would have had to ask for a different room because I would not have been able to use the toilet! Other than that I would recommend this lovely hotel and if I had a different room I would stay there again. The street it is on has lots of restaurants and little shops and lots of major sites and the metro are within easy walking distance. We used their shuttle service and the driver was very, very good and for what they charge the service is well worth it - I thought it was really reasonable and I am sure nobody wants to haul luggage through the metro after an 8 hour flight so this is an excellent alternative.
reviews.title: Location makes up for other things!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Came to Paris to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary and this hotel was a perfect choice for us. The entire staff was unfailingly kind and helpful and we were made to feel extremely welcome during our entire stay. Although it turned chilly and damp during our visit, the AC continued to work so no problem there. Our room faced the street, yet the double glazing made everything very quiet. When we opened the windows in the morning, yes, you could hear the trash pickup but it was not at an early hour so I don't understand what the fuss is about. Even tho we had a deluxe room, it was small but we knew that going in, and it was delightful with an extremely comfortable bed, extra pillows and blankets, a well stocked mini-bar with reasonable prices and a wonderful tray with tea/coffee/chocolate and madeleines. How they manage to incorporate so many nice touches and such abundant storage in limited square footage, I have no idea! The bathroom had multiple under sink shelves and plenty of counter space. The fixtures were lovely and there was always lots of hot water and wonderful water pressure. An added bonus is that the mini fridge kept one closet warm so clothes dried quickly! Breakfast was abundant and filling; so much so that we often didn't eat again until dinner. My only regret is my lack of foresight in not planning a longer stay. Before we even left the hotel, we were already planning our next visit. I have traveled all over the world and stayed in some remarkable places, but this one is certainly in the top 3.
reviews.title: Perfect Choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a superb small inn with just 12 rooms right in the middle of Paris. The "I'Isle" is just 6 blocks long by 3 blocks wide and is very residential-- one of the priciest addresses in the city. Really-- the local realtor office lists several apartments on the island over 2 million Euros! The Cathedral of Notre Dame is 4 blocks away and 2 metro stops are within 6 blocks. The staff all comfortably directed us in English on our travels. We recommend the hop-on-hop-off Batobus (boat bus) service as a fun way to get near everywhere we wanted to go-- museums, Eiffel, shopping. The hotel is not cheap, but what is cheap about staying in a perfect neighborhood in Paris? Our rate was 169 Euros a night-- seems to be their standard for summer travel. We used their in-house breakfast just once at 13 Euros each, but it was actually a pretty good deal if you want meat, cheese, fruit, variety of breads, juice and unlimited coffee. A petit dejuner at most bistros would be 8-10 Euros for one coffee, one juice and one croissant. There is also a terrific boulangerie and fruit market within a block to stock up the night before to enjoy with in-room coffee or tea.
reviews.title: Location, location, location in the center of Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Unfortunately I can't recommend a hotel that clearly states it offers something it doesn't. The web site specifies self controlling air conditioning, but that only works if they have 'turned on the service' which was not the case during our stay. I will now ask in the future when making reservations, but buyer beware at this hotel. If its hot, you may not have a/c. As previous posters have mentioned, there are plenty of bars nearby with the noise involved til the early morning when the trash service starts, so having your window open will impact your sleep, even with ear plugs.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What an amazing hotel! We chose it owing to the good reviews we read on different sites and we were really impressed on arrival: our room was clean, cosy and quiet. The hotel is located on the Saint-Louis island and it is 2 blocks from Notre-Dame and close to the subway. In the area, you can find good restaurants (French cuisine) and nice little shops for buying presents.
reviews.title: A little gem located in Paris center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just spent 2 nights at this hotel and found it very central to all the sights (just behind Notre Dame) as well as comfortable and clean with all mod cons but plenty of atmosphere. The staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast adequate but not memorable. Being right in the centre of Paris is is noisy so earplugs highly recommended. I would recommend this hotel and will stay here again when we return to Paris.
reviews.title: Lovely small hotel with great Parisian atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location just across the bridge from Notre Dame in lovely Ile St Louis, a village in Paris on a small island. Walkingdistance to St Germain, Quartier Latin, Marais and close to all sort of shopping. The hotel is wonderful, small but cosy with nice clean rooms with everything you need. Minus for the blanket instead of duvet covers but comfortable bed. Nice bathroom. Nice and helpful staff. Used their shuttle going to the airport which was great. Will absolutely go again. Did not eat their breakfastbuffé, went to lovely Café Régis just up the corner instead.
reviews.title: Charming hotel but EXTREMELY noisy, no soundproofing

reviews.title: A nice little hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for the 1st two nights of our honeymoon. The rooms are tiny, but that's not surprising for Paris. It was clean and the hotel has recently upgraded and redecorated so all the fixtures and decor are modern and nice. The hotel is on Il St, Louis which is right in the heart of Paris and we only had to walk about a block to get to Notre Dame. The service was helpful and we arranged for them to pick us up at CDG when we arrived. Breakfast is included. Mostly continental but a few extras such as cheeses. If you want to be in the center of Paris within decent walking distance from everything, this is the place to be.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here before. The rooms are average size for Paris but they are clean and nice. Even with renovations they have done, however, the paint is starting to peel and there are open light sockets in the hall. The air conditioning was not turned on and should have been. The service is friendly and accommodative. We would stay there again.
reviews.title: good location and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Saint-Louis was the perfect small hotel for Paris. Great location on the small island with excellent shops and small cafes. A quick walk across the pedestrian bridge and you are at Notre Dame. Very nice staff who speak good english. Rooms are small as most are, but I would consider an upgrade if you have 2 bags and 2 people and want a larger bed.
reviews.title: Paris Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This little hotel is a treasure. It's a little small, but the rooms are super clean, the beds are comfortable and everything worked just as it was supposed to. I think the thumbnail is our room. The staff, particularly Bernard and Denis, were very patient, kind, helpful and gracious from the moment we arrived. The location, as others have noted, could not be better. It is a short walk to Notre Dame and Sainte Chappelle, the Latin Quarter, the Marais and several Metro stations that open up the entire city. There are a number of nice restaurants and cafes within a stone's throw (I had cafe creme at the Cafe St. Regis every morning) and several very cool shops selling unique and tasteful Paris-themed items. The only downside is that the trash is picked up pretty early and it can get a little noisy with the windows open. Close them and the noise pretty much goes away. Overall, I cannot recommend Hotel Saint-Louis en l'Isle more highly.
reviews.title: Beautiful, friendly, convenient

description: In the heart of Ile Saint-Louis, the hotel Saint-Louis en l’Isle has an outstanding location. A very quiet place in the middle of Paris, the Ile Saint-Louis is a village with a prestigious history, symobolized by the 17th century town houses that lie there. Very close to Notre-Dame cathedral, the Marais quarter, the Place de la Bastille and the Saint-Germain quarter, you will find in Ile Saint-Louis unique Parisian authenticity, well-being and hospitality. A charming hotel by excellence, the hotel Saint-Louis en l’Ile will welcome you in a warm atmosphere. Visible stones, old terra cotta and oak beams make this place unique. An elevator serves all floors, including the stone vaulted basement where breakfast is served.Whether your visit is for tourism or business, the hotel Saint-Louis en l´Isle will see to your needs.
